availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Major Kimbrough (Harrison County, Kentucky, blacksmith and farmer. )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, blacksmith and farmer. Virginia native. Married to Margaret Kimbrough. Father of Charles R. Kimbrough, Minerva Kimbrough, and Nancy Kimbrough. Blacksmith in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 84B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 377.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 607.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 125B.
